intro: Aegopogon debilis, commonly known as the slender goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, leafless stems with whorled leaves that are hairy and lance-shaped. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. Aegopogon debilis typically grows in grassy areas and is adapted to dry, sandy soils.
